docs.abstract: With a little trepidation, Peter J. Henning offers up his thoughts on a few topics that should continue to be of interest in 2018.
docs.snippet: With a little trepidation, Peter J. Henning offers up his thoughts on a few topics that should continue to be of interest in 2018.
docs.lead_paragraph: From the surging value of cryptocurrencies to the continuing investigation of Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election, developments in 2017 were hard to forecast. Who could have predicted that an article in The New York Times in October describing sexual misconduct by the movie mogul Harvey Weinstein would unleash a torrent of claims about media stars, members of Congress and the judiciary and even an N.F.L. owner?

headline.main: From Bitcoin to Russia Investigation, a Look Ahead at 2018

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: Advertisers, especially smaller ones, complain of inconsistency and gender bias in the process that determines whether images are rejected for being sexually suggestive.
docs.snippet: Advertisers, especially smaller ones, complain of inconsistency and gender bias in the process that determines whether images are rejected for being sexually suggestive.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Krista Venero, an author who writes under the pen name K.L. Montgomery, bought ads on Facebook for a romance novel she published last year, she thought her marketing fell well within the bounds of the social network’s policies.

headline.main: Facebook Lets Ads Bare a Man’s Chest. A Woman’s Back Is Another Matter.
headline.print_headline: Facebook Issue Laid Bare: Man’s Chest vs. Woman’s Back

byline.original: By Sapna Maheshwari and Sheera Frenkel

docs.abstract: Citigroup reported a one-time charge of $22 billion on Tuesday to adjust for the new tax law, but said it expected earnings to rise in the future.
docs.snippet: Citigroup reported a one-time charge of $22 billion on Tuesday to adjust for the new tax law, but said it expected earnings to rise in the future.
docs.lead_paragraph: Citigroup said on Tuesday that the new tax law would cost the banking giant $22 billion, resulting in a loss for the fourth quarter of 2017 and slightly reducing the amount of capital it has to protect against future losses.

headline.main: Citigroup Takes a $22 Billion Tax Hit, but Sees Higher Profits Ahead

docs.abstract: New studies suggest the president’s plan would foster as little as $20 billion in new infrastructure spending. The Trump administration claims $1.5 trillion.
docs.snippet: New studies suggest the president’s plan would foster as little as $20 billion in new infrastructure spending. The Trump administration claims $1.5 trillion.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Independent analysts are beginning to forecast that President Trump’s infrastructure plan will pack much less of an economic punch than the administration predicts and is unlikely to jump-start new spending on roads, bridges and other critical projects.

headline.main: Experts Doubt Trump’s Infrastructure Plan Will Boost Economy
headline.print_headline: Experts Doubt Trump’s Infrastructure Plan Will Fuel Growth

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: White House Council of Economic Advisers

docs.abstract: Founts of foot traffic, hotels are popping up in developments that combine retail and restaurants with housing and offices.
docs.snippet: Founts of foot traffic, hotels are popping up in developments that combine retail and restaurants with housing and offices.
docs.lead_paragraph: When North American Properties drew up plans for a luxury hotel at Avalon, its $1 billion, 86-acre housing, office, restaurant and shopping project in the Atlanta suburb of Alpharetta, the developer wanted to reinforce the enclave’s stature as a Main Street destination with white-glove service.

headline.main: Developers Add a Missing Piece to Their Projects: Hotels
headline.print_headline: Retail and Office Projects Add Lodging to the Mix

docs.abstract: The former White House aide no longer plans to sell his firm to HNA Group, a company with close ties to the Chinese government.
docs.snippet: The former White House aide no longer plans to sell his firm to HNA Group, a company with close ties to the Chinese government.
docs.lead_paragraph: Anthony Scaramucci, the Wall Street investor whose short tenure as President Trump’s White House communications director elevated him to national prominence, is not going to sell his hedge fund company to a Chinese conglomerate after all, the two companies announced on Monday.

headline.main: Chinese Firm Scraps Deal to Buy Anthony Scaramucci’s Hedge Fund
headline.print_headline: Scaramucci Won’t Sell Hedge Fund To a Suitor

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)

docs.abstract: Chipotle has shunned the menu changes and marketing campaigns common in the fast-food industry. Its new chief may have to challenge that culture.
docs.snippet: Chipotle has shunned the menu changes and marketing campaigns common in the fast-food industry. Its new chief may have to challenge that culture.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nacho fries! Tuscani Pasta! Chicken Alfredo! Posters and sales pitches for Taco Bell’s latest menu additions cover the windows of a store on a busy Manhattan block.

headline.main: He Led a Turnaround at Taco Bell. Can He Do It at Chipotle?
headline.print_headline: Can Taco Bell Architect Duplicate Success at Chipotle?

docs.abstract: More and more customers are playing the immersive games called escape rooms, making the market for these small businesses increasingly competitive.
docs.snippet: More and more customers are playing the immersive games called escape rooms, making the market for these small businesses increasingly competitive.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hijacked airplanes, derailed subway cars and trapped submarines are usually the stuff of nightmares. A growing number of entrepreneurs, though, are catering to customers willing to pay to escape these types of situations for fun.

headline.main: Breaking Into the Boom in Escape Rooms: What Entrepreneurs Need to Know
headline.print_headline: Staying at the Cutting Edge of the Escape Room Craze

docs.abstract: The Swiss pharmaceutical giant said Felix R. Ehrat would retire, after the company said this month it had made payments to President Trump’s personal lawyer.
docs.snippet: The Swiss pharmaceutical giant said Felix R. Ehrat would retire, after the company said this month it had made payments to President Trump’s personal lawyer.
docs.lead_paragraph: Novartis’s top lawyer is to retire from the company over payments made by the pharmaceutical giant to President Trump’s personal lawyer Michael D. Cohen, the Swiss drug maker said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Novartis’s Top Lawyer is Out Amid Furor Over Payments to Michael Cohen
headline.print_headline: Novartis’s Top Lawyer Is Out Amid Furor Over Cohen Payments

byline.original: By Prashant S. Rao and Katie Thomas

docs.abstract: Citigroup, one of country’s largest credit card issuers, said that customers holding 1.75 million accounts would receive average refunds of $190.
docs.snippet: Citigroup, one of country’s largest credit card issuers, said that customers holding 1.75 million accounts would receive average refunds of $190.
docs.lead_paragraph: Citigroup is preparing to issue $330 million in refunds after the bank discovered it had overcharged nearly two million credit card accounts on their annual interest rates, a spokeswoman said on Friday.

headline.main: Citi to Refund $330 Million to Credit Card Customers It Overcharged
headline.print_headline: Citi Overcharged Credit Card Customers $330 Million
